intro: Tripogonella minima, commonly known as the lesser sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers.
